title: Buses, trains run smoothly today
body_lines: All Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) buses and trains are running as usual as per scheduled time tables, SLTB and Railways officials said.
The SLTB Deputy General Manager, Panduka Swarnahansa, said they have taken steps to operate buses on all routes across the country, although the schools were allowed holiday this week.

Although the schools are closed, several buses that were assigned for school transportation are kept ready to meet the requirement, the remaining buses were assigned for public transportation, "he said.
Gamini Seneviratne, the Railways' Deputy General Manager, also stated that all trains were on line as usual in the morning and will continue  this evening as well.

"But we could run only a handful of trains today, despite there are large number of commuters opt to travel by train. Nevertheless, the department has taken steps to operate the trains as per the time table," he said.

Meanwhile, the private bus owners said that they are hoping to operate the buses upon the availability of fuel. They said since diesel was supplied to every fuel station in Colombo, the queues for diesel would minimise. (Chaturanga Samarawickrama)
